Package com.Akif

Class RedBlackTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

java.lang.Object
com.Akif.BinaryTree<E>
com.Akif.BinarySearchTree<E>
com.Akif.BinarySearchTreeWithRotate<E>
com.Akif.RedBlackTree<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SearchTree<E>, java.io.Serializable
public class RedBlackTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
extends BinarySearchTreeWithRotate<E>
RedBlackTree.java Implements a Red-Black binary search tree Red-Black trees were invented by Bayer with refinments (the color convention) introduced by Guibas and Sedgewick.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add​(E item)
      Insert an item into the tree. This is the starter method of a recursive process.
      Specified by:
      add in interface SearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
      Overrides:
      add in class BinarySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
      Parameters:
      item - - The item to be inserted
      Returns:
      true if item inserted, false if item already in the tree.

    • delete

      public E delete​(E item)
      Delete starter method. Removes the given object from the binary search tree. Post: The object is not in the tree
      Specified by:
      delete in interface SearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
      Overrides:
      delete in class BinarySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
      Parameters:
      item - - The object to be removed.
      Returns:
      The object from the tree that was removed or null if the object was not in the tree.

    • findLargestChild

      protected E findLargestChild​(BinaryTree.Node<E> parent)
      Find the node such that parent.right.right == null post The found node is removed from the tree and replaced by its left child (if any)
      Parameters:
      parent - - The possible parent
      Returns:
      the value of the found node
